topGenerations.author: Skquark
topGenerations.content:
So I've got the Neggles version of AnimateDiff integrated into my UI at https://DiffusionDeluxe.com for Colab & Desktop, and now working on updating it with the additional features of s9roll7 fork, and could use some feedback.  Want to add options for the 'prompt_map', 'controlnet_map', 'upscale_config' and reference image.. wanting to make it as friendly as possible while opening all the extra settings, and trying to decide what defaults I can leave static.  When enabling a ControlNet layer, do I upload the init images into the controlnet_image subfolder or is that intended to be internal storage for the save_detectmap taken from the 1st animate frame?  Also when I use 'prompt_map' with frames instead of 'prompt' list, should the 'n_prompt' only have one negative string in it?
Thanks, open to collaborators if anyone wants to help smooth out my code..

topGenerations.author: Kosinkadink
topGenerations.content:
My work on Gen2 code is 99% complete, and now I will be starting work on the README and wiki, with the intended release into main branch to be tomorrow.

There are a lot of changes that had to happen in the code to support the features I added + features that will be added in the near future. It would be a great help to everyone involved if peeps could start testing the develop branch of AnimateDiff-Evolved while I'm working on the README and wiki so that we can catch any easy-to-find bugs before everyone is impacted by them when it gets merged to main.

Here are the features of Gen2:
- Introduction of Gen2 nodes that separate out model loading from application, allowing no motion models to be used at all while still supporting Sample Settings and Context Options features. The previous loader is referred to as Gen1 node, and all the features are supported there too since the backend is the same.
- Support for use of multiple motion models at once, with individual masking support for each
- Introduction of Multival inputs for scale (previously called motion_scale) and effect values; this means using the Multival nodes, you can input not only a float value, but also either/or a list of floats or masks, to have direct control over where each motion module should take effect/motion scale, or to what extent
- Introduction of effect_multival input; unlike scale, this changes how much the motion model has an effect on the resulting animation.
- Support for scheduling motion model settings (scale + effect floats/masks) across timesteps
- Autoselect of beta_schedule for motion models
- FreeNoise support via the noise_type dropdown in Sample Settings; this makes generations that use contexts produce more coherent results
- Nonlooping Context Options (referred to as Standard Context Options); generations that makes use of Context Options are no longer forced to loop when using these, making them effectively extensions of the non-Context Options version of animations.
- Introduced View Options, which are basically sub-Context Options that act like a context window for Contexts that can improve stability of longer animations by doing the 'context' work within the motion model; basically, you can combine them with longer Context Lengths, depending on how much extra VRAM you have available
- Context Options can now be scheduled, to use different Context/View Options at different points in the sampling process
- Proper FreeInit implementation; DinkInit_v1 is still there for backward compatibility, but FreeInit is implemented as intended now
- Mac M1/M2/M3 support for v1 motion models without the need to manually change code
- renewed fp8 support to match comfyui changes (was broken for several weeks after a comfy change)

TL;DR in develop branch, you can have animations not loop and just basically extend your initial animation via the use of Standard context options, you can use FreeNoise to stabilize your outputs, and you can use View Options to create longer Context Options (if your VRAM supports it) to increase stability. I'll merge this into main tomorrow, but it would be great if as many people as possible could test develop branch now so we can find any regressions/issues prior to the merge

topGenerations.author: Kijai
topGenerations.content:
This workflow uses a wrapper node I made for CCSR (https://github.com/csslc/CCSR) :

https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-CCSR

As well as TiledDiffusion node from <@236726640313499649> :https://github.com/shiimizu/ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion

CCSR is very good at accurate upscaling, but tends to introduce heavy seams when used in tiled mode, using another pass with TiledDiffusion clears them up nicely in most cases. 

Depending on the input image you will probably have to adjust the start step until you see no seams.

Since I found that SDXL gave best results, and since SDXL lacks tile controlnet, I ended up using the recolor controlnet as it's the most similar: https://huggingface.co/stabilityai/control-lora/blob/main/control-LoRAs-rank256/control-lora-recolor-rank256.safetensors
The downside is that it changes the colors a bit, which I'm compensating for with color-match.

Update with new workflow: https://discord.com/channels/1076117621407223829/1196177599244812468/1196840262475980953

topGenerations.author: Kosinkadink
topGenerations.content:
FreeInit (at least my initial DinkInit_v1 impl), Sample Settings, and Noise Layers have now been added to AnimateDiff-Evolved. The seed_override options on Sample Settings/Noise Layer nodes can be used to provide a list of ints to use as seeds for each individual frame. Noise Layers can be masked on a per-frame basis. Default Iteration Options node also exists, which basically acts like a shortcut for stacking KSamplers one after the other.

Additionally, seed_gen can be changed to be either comfy or auto1111, and fun things can be done using noise_type such as constant noise (same noise for every frame), and repeated_context will repeat seed-generated noise to repeat every context_length frames. Please report any regressions or bugs to me on discord or via Github issues.

topGenerations.author: Kosinkadink
topGenerations.content:
AnimateLCM is now supported in AnimateDiff-Evolved. TL;DR it's a model that was released yesterday that is made specifically for use with LCM.

You don't need to add the ModelSamplingDiscrete node - lcm has been added to the beta_schedule dropdown and will be used with autoselect beta_schedule or if you manually select it in the dropdown. But remember to use the LCM lora + sampler_name in KSampler nodes!

topGenerations.author: Flipping Sigmas
topGenerations.content: This is the most consistent render I've got from trying 75+ different combination/workflows. It's basically <@88822364468412416>  latest LCM workflow with more controlnets (tile/lineart/depth) and an additional sharpening node, plus https://github.com/Extraltodeus/ComfyUI-AutomaticCFG I found out about in the chatter channel from <@750242555408547940> . Before the LCM motion modules, I was trying everything in Hotshot, which I really liked the look/style transfer of, but the consistency just wasn't there. I also wasn't getting great results with the upscale, so I turned that off, then cranked up the original resolution, switched to render each frame, then did 150 per render and put it all together in Premiere Pro

topGenerations.author: Kosinkadink
topGenerations.content: Reference ControlNet, specifically reference_attn (equivalent of reference_only in Auto1111) is now available in Advanced-ControlNet. Support for reference_adain and reference_adain+attn will be added soon either today or tomorrow. Supports all the usual Advanced-ControlNet bells and whistles. Only caveat is that masks work for whole frames, but not specific areas of frames.

topGenerations.author: matt3o
topGenerations.content:
I just pushed an update to the IPAdapter that lets you schedule the weights.

The effect is similar to sending a fading attention mask but it has several advantages. It's very light on the GPU and it decouples the weights from the attention mask. Empirically I would say that this method should grant better results compared to just masks.

The attached animations are done without controlnet and without masks, just fiddling with the weights. Finding the right weights is not easy and you need a lot of trial an error, but it's easier and faster than working with attention masks.

The workflow is attached to the image, I'm also providing the reference images used for the animations.

topGenerations.author: Kijai
topGenerations.content:
This is an example of my Spline Editor -node in action, which with some effort now plugs into <@396817315997417493> 's InstanceDiffusion nodes, allowing relatively simple creation of custom paths for the instances.

The required InstanceDiffusion models are automatically downloaded (1.37GB) on the first run from: https://huggingface.co/logtd/instance_diffusion/tree/main 
to ```ComfyUI\models\instance_models```

Other than that any 1.5 model should work. InstanceDiffusion can be very slow so LCM/TCD/HyperSD LoRAs are recommended, this example is with the simplest one LCM and AnimateLCM modtion model.

Note that these nodes are still pretty new and mostly untested, so problems probably will arise. Kept it otherwise pretty clean, not many custom nodes are used beyond the necessary, these need to be up to date:

https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-KJNodes
https://github.com/logtd/ComfyUI-InstanceDiffusion
https://github.com/Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-AnimateDiff-Evolved

topGenerations.author: Jas
topGenerations.content:
Comfy Dreams - #toblorones3

Not going to lie, this is the most ambitious AI video I ever attempted, and took me 9 days. I tried to use as many different methods as possible and fuse them together. It was a big experiment!

How I made it,
ComfyUI AnimateDiff:
vid2vid - with various controlnets, IP2P, Openpose, Depth, lineart
Ip2p - Smoke "late night" <@323115728146399234>  workflow
Ipadapter - consistent aesthetic 
SVD XL - Scenes in alien dream bar
Deforum - spiral zoom
Masking - Runway & <@179206814720720896> Greenscreen workflow
Udio - Sound
Photoshop - building scenes (computer monitor/desk)
Davinci - editing
Upscaled with Superbadassupscaler

I used community / adapted workflows from <#1149372684220768367>

topGenerations.author: SuperBeasts.AI (Brad)
topGenerations.content:
"Breaking free" #toblorones3

In this piece, I delve into themes of isolation and female empowerment. I explore the journey of breaking free from oppressive situations, such as domestic violence, where one may feel powerless. This work reflects the critical moment of deciding to leave and reclaiming one's power, leading to newfound freedoms.

Custom workflow using short series of images for each sequence with IPAdapter weight transitions and masking techniques to control depth, IP attention for subject/background and AnimateDiff motion.

Music created with Udio

topGenerations.author: matt3o
topGenerations.content:
I added an experimental "Style transfer precise" weight type to the IPAdapter. It offers less bleeding of the embeds between the style and composition layers especially when the subject of the reference image is very different from the image you want to generate. In the pictures you can see some examples.

It might change in the coming days if I find a better way to do it.

Let me know what you think. It works with SDXL and SD1.5 but as always SDXL is far superior with style transfer

topGenerations.author: matt3o
topGenerations.content:
## âž¡ï¸ ClipVision Enhancer Node

I've pushed a new (experimental) node that tries to overcome the 224x224 clipvision limit. It's a bit of a hack and honestly the result is not as good as I was hoping but the difference is noticeable enough so I'm making this public anyway.

In the images you can see the difference from the original IPAdapter and the Enhanced one in the center. I'm also adding a detail of the skin.

In the diagram a sum up of what I'm doing in case you are curious. We are squeezing blood out of a stone as always but I guess I'll take whatever I can get.

Again, very experimental and the code might change... I'm not even sure I'm doing the various tensor reshaping correctly but it seems to be working. Please check the new example in the repository for usage. In the "Mona Lisa" image you'll also find a workflow to evaluate the difference in upscaling with Tile.

The `enhance_ratio` parameter is very important. If you have other conditioning (ie: controlnet or composition ipa) you can set it very low to get more details. Otherwise you may need to increase the value (>0.5) to avoid hallucination. 

This is pretty advanced stuff and probably not needed in day-to-day use.

topGenerations.author: â„œð”¢ð”©ð”¦ð”
topGenerations.content:
This was a project I developed a few months ago and I am finally getting around to releasing it for everyone to play with. It uses IPAdapter Tiling and Segmentation to upscale the image similar to SD Ultimate Upscaler; but with almost perfect adherence to the original. Feel free to play around with settings.

It requires this model to run https://civitai.com/models/133005?modelVersionId=357609

I would recommend messing with the Denoise ratio on the detailer; the IPAdapter Tiled weights and end percentage, as well as the context_crop_factor.

Thanks for checking it out!

topGenerations.author: NebSH
topGenerations.content: This animation touches on a common human tendency: the instinct to bury our problems rather than face them head-on. Often, we hope they'll just go away, but in reality, they grow until they become overwhelming. This story isn't about giving a moral lesson, but rather a reflection on the importance of acknowledging and addressing our issues before they take up too much space in our lives.

topGenerations.author: akatz
topGenerations.content:
Hey everyone!

I'm super excited to share what I've been working on over the past couple of weeks: porting Depthflow to ComfyUI!

Check out and star the original [Depthflow repo](https://github.com/BrokenSource/DepthFlow) created by <@183692720064299008>!

I (like a few others in the Comfy world) have been struggling to find a good open-source rival to immersity.ai, a paid service that lets you generate 3D animations from 2D images.

Today I'm happy to say the wait is over!

With Depthflow nodes in ComfyUI you can create awesome-ly smooth 3D animations from a single input image and depthmap (or video!). With 6 different motion presets to choose from it's easy to get great looking results fast, and I mean _fast_, Depthflow generates long animations in seconds!

You also have the ability to customize animations with the addition of Motion Component nodes, which can be strung together to modulate all of the input parameters with functions like linear, exponential, arc, sine, cosine, etc.

Now the best part of this custom node pack? It's compatible with <@738104484114464889> 's Flex System!

That's right, every motion preset, component, and effect node is (optionally) capable of having it's parameters modulated using an input feature! Whether it's from audio for crazy audio-reactive effects, videos for features like brightness over time, mask distance, or motion detection, or time-based features like waves and pulses, the sheer amount of possibilities enabled by the Flex feature system is staggering!

I hope you guys find some crazy ways to use this node pack that I would never imagine, that's my challenge for you!

If you want to dive in and get started with the new nodes, be sure to check out the README on the repo first for some info! (and give me a â­ too!):

[Github repo for Depthflow Nodes](https://github.com/akatz-ai/ComfyUI-Depthflow-Nodes)

I also went ahead and created a short overview video talking about what's inside the node pack, as well as going over an example workflow I created to showcase the node's capabilities:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTQ_-CmK7GI

You can go ahead and download the example workflow for free from my patreon page:
https://www.patreon.com/posts/depthflow-113459757?utm_medium=clipboard_copy&utm_source=copyLink&utm_campaign=postshare_creator&utm_content=join_link

If you guys have any questions, or find any issues with the nodes or workflow, let me know in the thread below! I'm happy to try and help resolve any issues as I get to them.

Big thanks again to <@183692720064299008> and <@738104484114464889> for creating the code that allowed for this node pack to exist!

As always I hope this helps! Don't stop creating! ðŸ’œ

Hello,  I finally finished cleaning this workflow, the goal is to use LLama 3.2 11B Vision and have it act as movie directors by describing images the way one would do it. 

I have written a few different "Directors", each of them have their own style, play with them and see which one you like best.


This idea was borrowed from the way LTXStudio creates videos. This tool allows you to quickly create storyboards and short stories, what it also does is to generate 4 videos for every images you decide to animate.
https://app.ltx.studio/

topGenerations.author: Zuko / @allhailthealgo
topGenerations.content:
Hey all! Sharing the workflow I'm currently using to leverage FlowEdit with the SkyReels I2V model. It's very experimental but if you can get it working, it yields great results. 

There are some guides in the workflow, but you'll need to be running the latest nightly version of Comfy and the Enhance-A-Video implementation requires a fork from Kijai. 

More discussion on reddit here: https://www.reddit.com/r/StableDiffusion/comments/1iu9nj2/incredible_v2v_using_skyreels_i2v_and_flowedit/

topGenerations.author: VRGameDevGirl84(RTX 5090)
topGenerations.content:
ðŸŽ¬ Video Upscale & Enhancement Workflow ðŸ”§âœ¨

This workflow is built to upscale or enhance any video! Here's how to get the most out of it:

ðŸ”¹ Just Upscaling?
Skip the prompt and set sampler denoise between 0.3 - 0.5
âž¡ï¸ Keeps original content intact but boosts quality.
(Higher values = more enhancement)

ðŸ”¹ Want a Bit of Style Change?
Add a prompt and bump denoise to 0.7 - 0.8
âž¡ï¸ Great for soft edits or light creative tweaks.

âš ï¸ Heads-up:
Going above 0.85 denoise = generating a brand new video from the prompt.
No prompt? Expect randomness ðŸŽ²

ðŸŽ¯ Best used for:

ðŸ“¼ Low quality or low res videos

ðŸ–¼ï¸ CGI renders (e.g. Blender)

ðŸ” Giving old content a fresh shine

topGenerations.author: Nekodificador
topGenerations.content:
Hey guys! I wanted to share one of my quality-of-life workflows with you. It's basically a collection of tools to generate control maps that come in super handy for post-production, VFX, and WAN-based control techniques.

The workflow is designed so you can just load a video, pick which maps you want to generate, select if you wanna preview or save them, and smash the Run button with your head. 

It automatically exports everything into a folder organized by date and project name, so you can keep all your maps neatly sortedâ€”even if youâ€™re working on multiple shots in the same day. Nothing new or groundbreaking, just some structure to keep things flowing.

topGenerations.author: Nathan Shipley
topGenerations.content:
A NotebookLM chat interface made from the Wan 2.1 channel conversations on Banodoco as it's data source.

Wan is overwhelming! It's hard to search! Kijai is busy! (Plus should you really be pinging him?) 

..try out the chattable Wan KB:

**LINK (requires a Google account):  
https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/a08901b9-0511-4926-bbf8-3c86a12dc306 **

Ask it questions like:
> What is VACE?
> What settings should I be using for CausVid?  What about kijai's CausVid v2?
> Can you give me an overview of the model ecosytem?
> What do people suggest to reduce VRAM usage?
> What are the main new things people discussed last week?

I scraped: 
<#1342763350815277067> 
<#1344309523187368046>  
<#1344057524935983125> 
from their beginning in February 2025 until June 18, 2025 and uploaded that data as sources to NotebookLM.

Tools and info if you'd like to make your own:
- <:discord:1071095388729249802> I'm using [DiscordChatExporter](https://github.com/Tyrrrz/DiscordChatExporter) to scrape the channels.
- ðŸ§¹ [discord-text-cleaner](https://nathanshipley.github.io/discord-text-cleaner/): A web tool to make the scraped text lighter by removing {Attachment} links that NotebookLM doesn't need.
- ðŸª“ [splitByLines_DateRange.py](https://gist.github.com/nathanshipley/e69daba2d808e5f68ef3e8b8a3a44825): A python script to split large text files into smaller ones that NotebookLM can ingest.  (seems to prefer ~20,000 lines or less)
- â–¶ï¸  More information about my process [on Youtube here](https://youtu.be/kG81Kkal5XM), though now I just directly download to text instead of HTML as shown in the video.

An older, static knowledge base with some example images and videos is available here on Notion.  It is current up to April 7, 2025:
https://nathanshipley.notion.site/Wan-2-1-Knowledge-Base-1d691e115364814fa9d4e27694e9468f

topGenerations.author: JohnDopamine
topGenerations.content:
After a number of days chatting w/ various LLMs, extracting/merging blocks, and generating over 50 33gb checkpoints w/ various combinations of minor alterations here's my best attempt at getting Vace 2.1 to work w/ Wan2.2. I'm not an expert at testing so no promises on quality or performance, but I figured after the time I played around w/ this I might as well toss it out for review and discussion than just sitting on it.

https://huggingface.co/CCP6/FakeVace2.2/tree/main


Example prompts:

An elderly man with a rugged gray beard is sitting inside a Starbucks coffeeshop in New York's Time's Square hanging out with his new favorite plushtoy. The yellow plush toy is sitting on the coffee table in front of him and he is telling it a story emphatically waving his arms around as if the plush were real. After a moment of this an employee can be seen walking up behind the old man and tapping him on the shoulder about to ask him if he's feeling healthy. 


Shrek and the woman, maintaining their exact appearances, now stand in a medieval-style room. Shrek holds the telescope, looking curious. The woman, still smiling, moves closer to him, her hand gently touching the telescope. They interact playfully, with Shrek showing her something through the telescope. The room has wooden beams and a warm, ambient light. Camera captures their interaction in a medium shot, emphasizing their expressions and the telescope. The scene remains consistent in appearance and lighting.

topGenerations.author: Jonathan
topGenerations.content:
So I've been testing this the past day, but you can actually input an image of anything (people, objects, etc) and then use a prompt like "the scene abruptly hard cuts to" or "the scene immediately changes to" to have that thing in a different context.

Essentially acting a subject reference without having to use VACE or Phantom. You can even change different aspects of the subject through prompting, and it still maintains the resemblance.

I'm still testing different prompts trying to find one that cuts the quickest (sometimes it will cut instantly, other times it will have a transition), but I hope someone with a faster computer can quickly generate videos to find the best implementation of this.

For the prompt structure I've found this to work the best so far: 

Prompt = Original Subject Description + Scene Cut Prompt + New Scene Description

Also I've found adding "The subjects appearance/hairstyle remains the same" to the end of the prompt has an effect as well.

topGenerations.author: VRGameDevGirl84(RTX 5090)
topGenerations.content:
ðŸŽ¬ New Workflows: HUMO & Infinite Talk

Iâ€™ve built two new workflows for making infinite-length videos in ComfyUI.
These workflows use my custom nodes to split audio into scenes and then recombine generated clips into one seamless video.

âš¡ HUMO Workflow

Default: 16 scenes (â‰ˆ1 minute video).

Each scene = 3 seconds by default.

Unlimited scenes â€” you can add more groups for longer videos.

Strengths:

Much better motion and visual flow.

Faster to generate.

Supports multi-image input for variation per scene.

Best for: Dynamic, visually rich videos where flow matters.

ðŸŽ¤ Infinite Talk Workflow

Default: 6 scenes (but you can add unlimited more).

Flexible scene length â€” each scene can be short or very long.

Example: Scene 1 could be 1 min, Scene 2 could be 5 min.

Reference images: You can use one shared image or set a different image per scene.

Strengths:

Perfect for syncing video with lyrics or custom audio timing.

Great for extended videos where scene timing must match music.

Tradeoff: Motion is less strong compared to HUMO.

ðŸ§© Summary

HUMO: Best for strong motion, cinematic flow. Default 3s per scene, but you can chain unlimited scenes for longer videos.

Infinite Talk: Best for full timing control. Scene length is totally flexible, and each scene can use its own reference image if desired.

Both workflows let you create infinite-length videos aligned to your audio.

âœ¨ If you want cinematic flow â†’ go HUMO.
If you want total timing control â†’ go Infinite Talk.

topGenerations.author: RyanOnTheInside
topGenerations.content:
What's up yall, long time no see.

I have been head-down working on this enhanced version of StreamDiffusion with the team at Livepeer and wanted to share this example.

This is fully accelerated with TensorRT, using SDXL, multi-controlnet, and IPAdapter. TensorRT acceleration of IPAdapters in novel as far as I know, but either way I am excited about it!

This example is using standard IPAdapter, but IPAdapter+ and IPAdapter FaceID are also supported.

The multiple controlnets slows this down a fair bit, but without them I get around 30 fps with SDXL at this resolution on my 5090.

Here I am using SDXL, but SD1.5 and SDTurbo are also supported.

There are a bunch of other goodies we added as well, including full real-time parameter updating, prompt/seed blending, multi-stage processing, dynamic resolution, and more... I am losing track:

https://github.com/livepeer/StreamDiffusion



Cross posting from [here ](https://www.reddit.com/r/StableDiffusion/comments/1ncx7g3/streamdiffusion_sdxl_ipadapter_multicontrolnet/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button)

llm written hype:

Say goodbye to static, lifeless motion. FlippinRad Motion Morph is a custom LoRA designed for Wan2.1 that injects dynamic, stylized movement straight into your animations â€” effortlessly.

Inspired by the flow of AnimateDiff and the precision of Steerable Motion, this model doesnâ€™t just move â€” it performs. Frames snap, twist, stretch, and flow with purpose, delivering cinematic motion that feels handcrafted and alive.

Built for creators who want more than just motion â€” who want character, flair, and rhythm â€” FlippinRad is your secret weapon for expressive, eye-catching animation with a signature style. No complex setup. No overengineering. Just pure motion artistry, right out of the box.

topGenerations.author: VRGameDevGirl84(RTX 5090)
topGenerations.content:
OK finally got a full video. This was  95% fully automated using my Z-image / Wan2.2 FML / Humo workflow. - I added an LLM that creates the prompts for the images based off the text to video prompt.  The only manual work I did was extract the lyrics using a separate workflow and give that to a custom GPT along with the real lyrics and it then gave me correct lyrics since whisper doesn't always get them right. I then took the corrected lyrics and ran it through another GPT that then created all the text to video prompts. I pasted the prompts into the workflow, hit run and it created this full length video.   If you want more details on the WF and have enough VRAM (12GB Recommended)  you can go here to get the WF and custom nodes. https://github.com/vrgamegirl19/comfyui-vrgamedevgirl/tree/main/Workflows

- This full video was created straight from comfyUI. NO manual or post edits were made.

I did not review any prompts before making this so it ends up being a surprise.  LOL   some things didn't turn out here and there but overall not bad for automation.
